segment.source: Assign Security Group Filters to the GPO (Windows 10)
segment.target: Assign Security Group Filters to the GPO (Windows 10)

segment.source: Assign Security Group Filters to the GPO
segment.target: Assign Security Group Filters to the GPO

segment.source: Assign Security Group Filters to the GPO
segment.target: Assign Security Group Filters to the GPO

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: To make sure that your GPO is applied to the correct computers, use the Group Policy Management MMC snap-in to assign security group filters to the GPO.
segment.target: To make sure that your GPO is applied to the correct computers, use the Group Policy Management MMC snap-in to assign security group filters to the GPO.

segment.source: Important: This deployment guide uses the method of adding the Domain Computers group to the membership group for the main isolated domain after testing is complete and you are ready to go live in production.
segment.target: Important: This deployment guide uses the method of adding the Domain Computers group to the membership group for the main isolated domain after testing is complete and you are ready to go live in production.

segment.source: To make this method work, you must prevent any computer that is a member of either the boundary or encryption zone from applying the GPO for the main isolated domain.
segment.target: To make this method work, you must prevent any computer that is a member of either the boundary or encryption zone from applying the GPO for the main isolated domain.

segment.source: For example, on the GPOs for the main isolated domain, deny Read and Apply Group Policy permissions to the membership groups for the boundary and encryption zones.
segment.target: For example, on the GPOs for the main isolated domain, deny Read and Apply Group Policy permissions to the membership groups for the boundary and encryption zones.

segment.source: Administrative credentials
segment.target: Administrative credentials

segment.source: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the relevant GPOs.
segment.target: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the relevant GPOs.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Allow members of a group to apply a GPO
segment.target: Allow members of a group to apply a GPO

segment.source: Prevent members of a group from applying a GPO
segment.target: Prevent members of a group from applying a GPO

segment.source: To allow members of a group to apply a GPO
segment.target: To allow members of a group to apply a GPO

segment.source: Use the following procedure to add a group to the security filter on the GPO that allows group members to apply the GPO.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to add a group to the security filter on the GPO that allows group members to apply the GPO.

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management console.
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management console.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, find and then click the GPO that you want to modify.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, find and then click the GPO that you want to modify.

segment.source: In the details pane, under Security Filtering, click Authenticated Users, and then click Remove.
segment.target: In the details pane, under Security Filtering, click Authenticated Users, and then click Remove.

segment.source: Note: You must remove the default permission granted to all authenticated users and computers to restrict the GPO to only the groups you specify.
segment.target: Note: You must remove the default permission granted to all authenticated users and computers to restrict the GPO to only the groups you specify.

segment.source: Click Add.
segment.target: Click Add.

segment.source: In the Select User, Computer, or Group dialog box, type the name of the group whose members are to apply the GPO, and then click OK.
segment.target: In the Select User, Computer, or Group dialog box, type the name of the group whose members are to apply the GPO, and then click OK.

segment.source: If you do not know the name, you can click Advanced to browse the list of groups available in the domain.
segment.target: If you do not know the name, you can click Advanced to browse the list of groups available in the domain.

segment.source: To prevent members of a group from applying a GPO
segment.target: To prevent members of a group from applying a GPO

segment.source: Use the following procedure to add a group to the security filter on the GPO that prevents group members from applying the GPO.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to add a group to the security filter on the GPO that prevents group members from applying the GPO.

segment.source: This is typically used to prevent members of the boundary and encryption zones from applying the GPOs for the isolated domain.
segment.target: This is typically used to prevent members of the boundary and encryption zones from applying the GPOs for the isolated domain.

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management console.
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management console.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, find and then click the GPO that you want to modify.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, find and then click the GPO that you want to modify.

segment.source: In the details pane, click the Delegation tab.
segment.target: In the details pane, click the Delegation tab.

segment.source: Click Advanced.
segment.target: Click Advanced.

segment.source: Under the Group or user names list, click Add.
segment.target: Under the Group or user names list, click Add.

segment.source: In the Select User, Computer, or Group dialog box, type the name of the group whose members are to be prevented from applying the GPO, and then click OK.
segment.target: In the Select User, Computer, or Group dialog box, type the name of the group whose members are to be prevented from applying the GPO, and then click OK.

segment.source: If you do not know the name, you can click Advanced to browse the list of groups available in the domain.
segment.target: If you do not know the name, you can click Advanced to browse the list of groups available in the domain.

segment.source: Select the group in the Group or user names list, and then select the box in the Deny column for both Read and Apply group policy.
segment.target: Select the group in the Group or user names list, and then select the box in the Deny column for both Read and Apply group policy.

segment.source: Click OK, and then in the Windows Security dialog box, click Yes.
segment.target: Click OK, and then in the Windows Security dialog box, click Yes.

segment.source: The group appears in the list with Custom permissions.
segment.target: The group appears in the list with Custom permissions.
